headline: The Score: Disney, Berkshire Hathaway, Ford and More Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: Investors celebrated  Disney’s  plans for a new theme park.  Disney also posted strong earnings, saying that its U.S. theme parks attracted more guests and higher spending from visitors in the March quarter.  Disney and its rivals continue to face issues such as declining cable-TV usage and underperformance at the box office.

Disney and its rivals continue to face issues such as declining cable-TV usage and underperformance at the box office.

headline: Boeing is the big winner in Trump's first trade deal
summary: Boeing (BA) is reaping the early rewards of the Trump administration’s first tariffs-era trade deal between the U.S. and the United Kingdom. A major order from British Airways (IAG)’ parent company, IAG, just provided a crucial win for the U.S. aerospace giant after a turbulent year.

headline: IAG orders 71 long-haul jets split between Airbus and Boeing
summary: British Airways owner IAG on Friday unveiled plans to buy 71 long-haul aircraft from Airbus and Boeing, sharing a major fleet expansion across the Atlantic a day after Britain and the U.S. announced a trade deal.  The airline group announced a new order for 32 Boeing 787-10 aircraft for British Airways, and 21 Airbus A330-900neo aircraft.  It also disclosed for the first time options exercised in March for six Airbus A350-900s, as well as six Airbus A350-1000s and six Boeing 777-9s.

raw.headline: IAG orders 71 long-haul jets split between Airbus and Boeing
raw.summary: British Airways owner IAG on Friday unveiled plans to buy 71 long-haul aircraft from Airbus and Boeing, sharing a major fleet expansion across the Atlantic a day after Britain and the U.S. announced a trade deal.  The airline group announced a new order for 32 Boeing 787-10 aircraft for British Airways, and 21 Airbus A330-900neo aircraft.  It also disclosed for the first time options exercised in March for six Airbus A350-900s, as well as six Airbus A350-1000s and six Boeing 777-9s.
